description.S1: Abernathy asked you to bring him a cache of anthrocillin hidden in the Emerald Vale Community Center.

blurb.B1: This quest is started by speaking with Martin Abernathy and agreeing to freelance for him.
blurb.B2: He will ask the Stranger to retrieve a crate of Experimental Anthrocillin which is located in the Emerald Vale Community Center.
blurb.B3: He will also mention the dangers associated with the group of marauders that have recently taken over the center and its surrounding area.
blurb.B5: the Stranger is approached by Esther Blaine who makes a counteroffer.
blurb.B6: Abernathy is a hypochondriac, she claims,
blurb.B7: and she would put the medicine to better use.
blurb.B8: She offers to match the amount which Abernathy is offering.

description.S2: He wants a special cache of anthrocillin,
description.S3: found in the Emerald Vale Community Center.
description.S4: Esther confronted you outside of Abernathy's house,
description.S5: and suggested that you should give the medicine to her instead of Abernathy.

blurb.B1: You can find the Experimental Anthrocillin in the Emerald Vale Community Center inside the medical area.
blurb.B2: You'll need the Medical Bay key to get in there,
blurb.B3: which can be found on one of the Marauders.
blurb.B4: Once you obtain it you can give it to Esther or Martin.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Whoa! Did - uh - did Mr. Tobson send you?

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: You tell Mr. Tobson I'll be right at my post. Tomorrow. Bright and early, tomorrow. Because I am definitely not plagued. Spry as a spring chicken - that's old Abernathy.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Take it easy. Mr. Tobson didn't send me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I heard you muttering to yourself.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You want to tell me what's got you so nervous?

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Then what are you doing here? Visiting? Well, let me give you the grand tour. This here's my domicile - and there's the door.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: You wanna mingle, go try the cantina.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm here to collect your gravesite fees.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll leave you be.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Silas knows, doesn't he? That's why he sent you. That's why he wants me to pay up. He knows.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Knows what?

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'm dying. I'm not long for this world. The date of my expiration is fast approaching, and soon I shall be ushered through the great cannery in the skies.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: It's plague. Has to be. Silas knows. He knows I've got one foot in my grave, and now he wants to charge me for the other one.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm sorry to hear that.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're being paranoid.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm sure it's all very tragic and heartbreaking. Pay me so I can get out of here.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: You are? Oh. Wow. First time anyone's ever told me that.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'll pay your fees. I don't want any trouble from Silas. But if you could see your way to freelancing for me, I could really use the help.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How can I help?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why do you think I'm a freelancer?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Depends on what you need.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You can't afford me.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: There's a cache of anthrocillin tucked away in the old community center. Powerful stuff. Stronger than what we got, anyway.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: I need you to break in, nab that medicine, and bring it back to me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll do it.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Not so fast. I've got some questions.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll think about it.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Will you oblige me with your haste? I think I feel the plague spreadin'. Oh Law, it's in my spleen now. I can feel it.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Anything I should know about this community center?

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Just keep your head down when you're in there. Marauders have taken over. Probably tracking mud all over the archives.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'll do what I can.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why can't you just buy some medicine yourself?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I assume there are guards.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I've heard enough.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: I tried medicating myself with Adrena-Time. Didn't do much for me, far as I can tell.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Anyway, I can't just buy medicine. Distribution of medicine is strictly prohibited to any workers beneath the acceptable margin of health. Company policy.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: In other words, the company won't treat you because you're already sick.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: That's horrible.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Come on now, Abernathy. You don't look a day over ninety.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: More like the company won't treat me 'cause I'm not healthy enough.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: It is what it is. Town's got a limited supply of medicine. Medicine better spent on a body stronger and younger than mine.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Tell myself the same thing every morning. You seen those young workers at the cannery? What with their unbent spines and pristine knee joints. I can't compete with that.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: You will not find any guards within sight of that old place. Marauders, on the other hand...

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What can you tell me about these marauders?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You never mentioned marauders.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: I have it on good authority there's a gang of 'em squatting there. I advise stepping softly.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: It is a reality of life in the Vale. Grass is brown. Sky is grey. Marauders are outside the walls.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: So you'll do it, then?

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Oh, hey, I'm sorry. Didn't mean nothing by it. Wasn't trying to insult you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Never mind. What do you need done?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Why would I be insulted?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Don't worry about it.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Couple hours out of your day and some light second-story work. That's all.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: It's just - you ain't one of us. A Spacer, I mean. Stands to reason you've got no company looking after you.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Not your fault, though. Even freelancers gotta eat. And if that means they must scratch some bits out of odd jobs, who am I to judge 'em? Least you're not a deserter.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What kind of odd job are you referring to?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I guess that's fair.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Okay. That is a little insulting.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: So does that mean you're for hire? I could use the help, if you could use the work.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Look. I'm sorry. Never had much in the way of social graces. But the job is a good one, if you're interested.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: I'll scratch something together for you. Sell off some of my sundry at Moreau's if I have to. Just hear me out.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: I am? Law help me. Paranoia's one of the plague's known symptoms.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: Didn't nobody ever tell you to never impress yourself between a man and his muttering? Which is, by the way, a normal and healthy mode of expression.

dialog.speaker: MartinAbernathy (Male)
dialog.utterance: You some sort of wandering alienist? Walking into a man's own domicile, pestering him about his mental state.
